node.title: Fears border changes may burst domestic travel bubble
node.description: A Methven tourism operator fears the border opening may not result in the economic boom many are forecasting.

node.title: As it happened: Police move against Parliament protesters
node.description: Today's police actions against protesters on Parliament ground began early this morning. See how the events earlier today unfolded with RNZ's live updates.

node.title: Employment Court to consider injunction to stop health workers' strike
node.description: The Employment Court will tomorrow consider an injunction to stop a planned strike by thousands of health workers this Friday.

node.title: 'Largest ever' meth bust in NZ: Police, Customs seize 613kg of the drug
node.description: A shipment of 613 kilograms of methamphetamine - with what police say is a retail value of more than $245 million - was stopped at Auckland Airport last Thursday.

node.title: Australian PM tests positive for Covid-19
node.description: In a statement released late last night, Scott Morrison confirmed he took a PCR test after developing a fever on Tuesday evening.

node.title: Most speech watchers say State of the Union made them feel optimistic, proud - CBS News poll
node.description: More than half say the speech made them feel the coronavirus is mostly behind us

node.title: Biden uses State of the Union to call for focus on "burn pits"
node.description: "Veterans are the backbone and the spine of this country. They're the best of us," Mr. Biden said.

node.title: Covid-19 update: 22,152 new community cases, 405 people in hospital
node.description: There have been 22,152 new community cases of Covid-19 reported in New Zealand today, with 405 people in hospital, including 10 in intensive care.

node.title: 'He is disgraced': lawyer's submission as league star Manu Vatuvei jailed
node.description: Former rugby league star Manu Vatuvei has been sentenced to three years and seven months in prison for importing methamphetamine worth $200,000.

node.title: Iowa Governor Kim Reynolds delivers GOP response to State of the Union
node.description: Iowa Governor Kim Reynolds hit President Biden on inflation and crime, among other things.

node.title: Fact check: Joe Biden's State of the Union address
node.description: He has focused on Russia's invasion of Ukraine and has also addressed inflation in his first State of Union address.

node.title: Phoenix women post another win
node.description: The Wellington Phoenix have posted the second win of their maiden A-League women's season to give themselves a chance of moving off the bottom of the ladder.

node.title: Gina Raimondo selected as State of the Union designated survivor
node.description: The "designated survivor" is a person who is chosen to not attend the State of the Union so that they are able to take over the government if catastrophe strikes.

node.title: West Coast council defends floodwall progress
node.description: Lack of progress on Westport flood protection is being blamed on "insufficient appetite" to actually get on and do it.

node.title: Water restrictions on the horizon for Invercargill residents
node.description: Residents may face water restrictions as soon as next week as the river supplying the city's water is at risk of running low.

node.title: Jury selected for trial of first January 6 riot defendant Guy Reffitt
node.description: Eight men and eight women — all D.C. residents — will determine Reffitt's fate.

node.title: Family flees Russian invasion for second time
node.description: Olena and her son fled to Poland, while her husband had to stay back to help defend Ukraine.

node.title: Fiji PM returns to country after heart surgery in Australia
node.description: Fijian Prime Minister Frank Bainimarama has returned to the country after spending more than two months at a Melbourne hospital recovering from a heart surgery.

node.title: Child care costs keeping many women from returning to work
node.description: The cost of child care now amounts to 31% of the average income for women.

node.title: In photos: Early morning clash between police and protesters in Wellington
node.description: In the early hours of this morning, before the sun had risen, police geared up for an operation to "restore order" to the streets of Wellington, 23 days into an anti-Covid protest on Parliament…

node.title: Romney: "I don't think that anybody can really assess" Putin's mental state
node.description: Reports have questioned Russian President Vladimir Putin's possible mental state.

node.title: $16.5m funding available for Matariki-related tourism infrastructure
node.description: There's $16.5 million up for grabs in a new funding round from the government as the nation prepares for the return of international tourists and more Kiwis returning home. Audio

node.title: Delays in RAT delivery the latest govt failure during pandemic, doctor says
node.description: A Dunedin doctor says the government has repeatedly failed to deliver the tools frontline health workers need to do their jobs. Audio

node.title: 'Happy and at peace': Dame Valerie Adams ready for retirement
node.description: One of the great New Zealand athletes says it's time to hang up her size 14 throwing shoes.

node.title: Poison in wine believed to be behind Northland man's death - police
node.description: Police believe a Northland man who died in December drank poisoned wine left in his letterbox.

node.title: New Zealand to contribute in global oil stocks release - Minister
node.description: Energy Minister Megan Woods has agreed to releasing emergency oil stocks along with other member states of the International Energy Agency.

node.title: MLB negotiations advance as league sets new Tuesday deadline
node.description: It's the bottom of the 9th for team owners and players, who must reach a deal today to avoid canceling games.

node.title: Ukraine conflict: Dread in Kyiv as huge Russian convoy advances
node.description: Satellite images convey, with searing clarity, the pace of Russia's progress towards Kyiv.

node.title: Cauliflower selling for nearly $15
node.description: Bad weather affecting crops has led to a shortage of cauliflower causing a spike in prices.

node.title: Ukraine envoy to US says Russia used a vacuum bomb in its invasion
node.description: Russia has been accused of attacking Ukranians with cluster bombs and vacuum bombs, weapons that have been condemned by a variety of international organisations.
